data.title: New releases for your streaming pleasure: Nov 27-Dec 3
data.description: Looking for a title to binge-watch this weekend? Here

data.title: Manhunt underway as 3 people shot dead in northeastern Thailand
data.description: NONG BUA LAMPHU: A man, 57, shot dead three people in Sri Bun Ruang district of this northeastern province on Wednesday morning.

data.title: Manhunt underway as 3 people shot dead in northeastern Thailand
data.description: NONG BUA LAMPHU: A man, 57, shot dead three people in Sri Bun Ruang district of this northeastern province on Wednesday morning.

data.title: Real Madrid Foundation Clinics Launches in Thailand
data.description: Patrick Group, in partnership with the Real Madrid Foundation, has officially launched the “Real Madrid Foundation Clinics Thailand,” marking the first program together in Thailand. This initiative offers a unique chance for Thai youths who are passionate about football to experience elite-level training designed to enhance their potential and skills, led by Real Madrid Foundation coaches traveling directly from Spain. The training camp will take place from February 12-16, 2025, at KIS International School Reignwood Park in Lam Luk Ka district, Pathum Thani province.

data.title: Man shot dead three people in Northeast
data.description: NONG BUA LAMPHU: A man, 57, shot dead three people in Sri Bun Ruang district of this northeastern province on Wednesday morning.

data.title: Sail into the Spectacle
data.description: Elevate your Pattaya International Fireworks Festival experience with the  Royal Cliff Hotels Group . Renowned for its luxury and nestled amidst lush tropical gardens overlooking the Gulf of Thailand, Royal Cliff offers the perfect blend of tranquillity and sophistication.

data.title: Thailand a favourite pick for data centre investors
data.description: Located in the heart of Southeast Asia and with robust communications technology, the country is continuing to draw global investment

data.title: Virgin Active Redefines Wellness with Bold New Campaign
data.description: Virgin Active, a global leader in wellness, has unveiled its transformative new campaign, Leave the Cult, Join the Club, marking a significant shift in how wellness is approached in today’s fast-paced, appearance-driven fitness world. In an exclusive interview, Dean Kowarski, Global CEO of Virgin Active, shared insights into the campaign’s vision, the brand’s unique approach to wellness, and its ambitious expansion plans, particularly in Southeast Asia.

data.title: Exclusive Moments: Inside the XM Gala Dinner, Bangkok 2024
data.description: Another year passes, and another triumph emerges! It’s time to reflect on a night of celebration and gratitude. XM, a trusted global multi-asset platform serving over 190 countries—especially in Thailand—welcomes you to relive the unforgettable XM Gala Dinner 2024 in Bangkok, 26th October 2024. This exclusive event brought together dazzling performances, luxurious prizes, and a night dedicated to appreciating our valued clients for their loyalty and trust.

data.title: TAT targets 9 million Chinese visitors in 2025
data.description: Tourism and Sports Minister assures his Chinese interlocuteur during meeting in Shanghai that Thailand is a safe place for visitors

data.title: Bangkok to renew fees to encourage sorting of rubbish
data.description: The Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) is expected to renew garbage collection fees next June as part of its efforts to encourage people to sort their household waste.

data.title: Airports of Thailand to pay B12bn due to noise pollution from new runway
data.description: Airports of Thailand (AoT) plans to issue 12 billion baht in compensation to residents impacted by noise pollution from the third and newest runway at Suvarnabhumi Airport.

data.title: Swedish tourist loses B42,000 to Pattaya thief
data.description: PATTAYA: A Swedish tourist told police that a thief stole about 42,000 baht worth of valuables from him early Wednesday morning.

data.title: Bangchak Collaborates on Medical Innovations for Health Sustainability
data.description: Bangchak Corporation Public Company Limited (Bangchak) has partnered with the King Mongkut’s Institute of Technology Ladkrabang (KMITL), CMKL University, and the King Mongkut’s Hospital Foundation in the Patriarch

data.title: Adviser to Thai PM sees coup threat in protests
data.description: Any anti-government demonstrations will likely lead to the illegitimate seizure of power, Nattawut Saikuar, an adviser to the prime minister, has warned.

data.title: Prawit confidant refutes iCon fraud connection rumours
data.description: Gen Vitch Devahasdin na Ayudhya, a close associate of Gen Prawit Wongsuwon, tried to distance the Palang Pracharath Party (PPRP) leader from politician Samart Janechaijittawanich, who was  arrested on Monday  in connection with the high-profile public fraud case linked to The iCon Group.

data.title: Dr Boon’s case could go beyond public fraud
data.description: Police suspect several other investors, many of them well-known personalities, have still not come forward to file complaints

data.title: Legal issues threaten Koh Samui maid's claim to late employer's estate
data.description: Nutwalai Pupongta, the trusted housemaid of a French businesswoman who committed suicide in Koh Samui on April 29, might not be able to inherit 100 million baht in assets from her former employer as police have found the deceased illegally ran businesses and owned luxury villas via nominees.

data.title: Maurice Lacroix AIKON Ceramic: Bold Urban Sophistication
data.description: As 2024 draws to a close, Maurice Lacroix unveils a masterpiece that merges technical innovation with timeless style: the  AIKON Automatic Ceramic . This striking addition to the AIKON collection offers a captivating blend of urban sophistication and cutting-edge materials, delivered in two contrasting finishes—stealthy black and radiant white—and available in 39mm and 42mm sizes.

data.title: Rules issued for migrant workers
data.description: Two ministerial regulations are being issued to prevent labour trafficking and extend legal protection for dependents of migrant workers, according to the Interior Ministry.

data.title: Meet to focus on Chiang Mai flood recovery
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra will hold her first mobile cabinet meeting in Chiang Mai under the theme "From Flood To Flourish", to rehabilitate Chiang Mai following major floods.

data.title: Israel and Hezbollah reach cease-fire agreement for Lebanon
data.description: Israel reached a deal for a 60-day cease-fire with the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah after weeks of talks mediated by the US, a first step toward ending a conflict that’s killed thousands of people and opening the door to fresh peace initiatives in the Gaza Strip.

data.title: Senate to hear testimonies on 'social media fraud'
data.description: Relevant agencies have been invited to testify at a Senate meeting next week on alleged fraud and money laundering involving Thonburi Healthcare Group founder Boon Vanasin, who is believed to be hiding out in China.

data.title: Vietnam, Thailand share experiences in combating drugs at sea
data.description: Thailand's Office of the Narcotics Control Board Deputy Secretary General Apikit Ch.rojprasert led a delegation to visit and work with the Coast Guard Region No. 3 Command in Ba Rịa - Vung Tau Province on Monday (November 25).

data.title: Mekong boat trip offers taste of timeless Luang Prabang
data.description: As the golden sun begins its descent, painting the sky in shades of amber and violet, a majestic wooden boat glides along the calm waters of the Mekong River. In the foreground, the charming city of Luang Prabang stretches across the riverside, nestled among lush green forests that seem to extend endlessly.

data.title: TNLA ready for talks to end armed conflicts, recognizes China's efforts
data.description: The Ta’ang National Liberation Army (TNLA) announced on November 25 its readiness to engage in discussions aimed at ending armed conflicts, acknowledging and respecting the efforts of the Chinese government to mediate for peace and stability along the border.

data.title: Adviser sees coup threat in protests
data.description: Any anti-government demonstrations will likely lead to the illegitimate seizure of power, Nattawut Saikuar, an adviser to the prime minister, has warned.

data.title: A royal concert at Mrigadayavan Palace
data.description: The beautiful historic seaside Mrigadayavan Palace in Cha-am, Phetchaburi province is the venue for a special concert, "Magical Melodies", which will be held at Samosorn Sevakamataya Throne Hall, on Dec 7 at 4pm.

data.title: Movies for your Thanksgiving fun
data.description: A significant holiday which falls annually on the fourth Thursday of November, Thanksgiving this year is observed tomorrow. Besides turkey and delicious pies, people spend time with families and loved ones to celebrate this occasion.

data.title: Enjoy a vintage weekend at Chakrabongse Villas
data.description: Chakrabongse Villas will get vibrant with the return of the Antiques & Culture Fair this Saturday and Sunday.

data.description: When aspiring photographer Thana Tharapit was a high school student, he decided to enter the School of Architecture, Art and Design at King Mongkut

data.description: The Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) is expected to renew garbage collection fees next June as part of its efforts to encourage people to sort their household waste.

data.title: Angels target knockout spot with victory
data.description: Bangkok United coach Totchtawan Sripan is targeting a victory as his team faces Singapore

data.title: Thailand gear up for title defence with star-studded side
data.description: Supachok Sarachat and his brother Suphanat Mueanta were named in the 26-player squad for the upcoming AFF Mitsubishi Electric Cup on Wednesday.
